quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Novel and Hero
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, war-hero, garrick. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This novel, set in Manhattan during the Wall Street boom of the late 1980s, is centered around the daily life of young investment banker Patrick Bateman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Psycho

questions.question: Bruce Wayne (Batman) has a butler named Alfred. What is Alfreds nationality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English

questions.question: Cyclops, Beast, The Angel, Iceman and Marvel Girl are from this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Original 5 X-men

questions.question: On what planet was the Silver Surfer born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zen La

questions.question: Jay Garrick and Barry Allen played the same role as this super hero.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Flash

questions.question: This novel by American author James Baldwin is noteworthy for bringing complex representations of homosexuality. It follows the events in the life of an American living in Paris.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giovannis Room

questions.question: In this novel by Norman Mailer, a decorated war-hero and former congressman murders his wife and descends into the underworld of Manhattan jazz clubs and Mafia intrigue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An American Dream

questions.question: Some famous assassinations and assassination attempts have been associated with this novel, most of which is set in New York City.

options.text: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Catcher in the Rye

questions.question: What is the pen name of Eric Blair who wrote the memoir Down and Out in Paris and London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: Robin, Kid Flash, Speedy, Aqua Lad and Wonder Girl are found in which of these groups?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The original 5 Teen Titans

questions.question: Aquaman, The Atom, Batman, The Flash, Green Arrow, Hawkman, Jonn Jonzz Martian Hunter, Superman and Wonder Woman are from which of these groups?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Justice League of America

questions.question: Captain America was a hero of World War 2 in the 1960s. He wakes up from a frozen state on board a submarine. What group found him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Avengers

questions.question: Dick Grayson, Jason Todd, Timothy Drake were all identified as this same super hero. Can you figure out which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin

questions.question: Allen Scot, Hal Jorden, John Stewart, Kyle Rainier, Guy Gardner have a costumed identity in common. What is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Lantern

questions.question: Can you finish this oath? In brightest day, in blackest night, no evil shall escape my sight, let those who worship evils might beware my power ....

options.text: This is a job for Superman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Lanterns Light

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Novels
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, plaths, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What company uses the swoosh as its logo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nike

questions.question: Which U.S. President declared June 14th as Flag Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodrow Wilson

questions.question: This literary work depicts Holly Golightly, a tenant in a brownstone apartment in Manhattan, who has become an American cultural icon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breakfast at Tiffanys

questions.question: The New York Trilogy, which consists of the novels City of Glass, Ghosts, and The Locked Room, is this authors signature work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Auster

questions.question: What 1994 novel by Joseph Heller is a sequel to the popular Catch-22?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Closing Time

questions.question: This is Sylvia Plaths only novel, which was originally published under the pseudonym Victoria Lucas. The protagonists descent into mental illness parallels Plaths own experiences.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bell Jar

questions.question: This novel by Edith Wharton focuses on an upper-class couple whose impending marriage is threatened by the appearance of a woman plagued by scandal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Age of Innocence

questions.question: Which of the following uncommon musical instruments does not contain strings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cuica

questions.question: There are a total of 4 oceans in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The character Nick Carraway is from which of the following novels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Gatsby

questions.question: The ttitle character of this novel, set in the roaring 1920s, is a mysterious host of regular, extravagant parties. He has become an archetype of self-made Americans seeking to join high society.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Gatsby

questions.question: Name the author of the novels The Fountainhead and Atlas Shrugged, which are both set in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ayn Rand

questions.question: The city of New York is composed of 5 boroughs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Approximately how long does it take the sun to reach the Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a little over 8 minutes

questions.question: Which spice is from the mint family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: oregano

quizzes.title: History Quiz: France and King
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, privileges, franks. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Queen consort of France was noted for her political intrigues at the French court. Following the assassination of her husband King Henry IV of France, she acted as regent for her son, King Louis XIII of France, until he came of age.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie de Medici

questions.question: Who became King of England after the monarchy was restored in 1660?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles II

questions.question: Following this kings execution, the monarchy was abolished and a republic called the Commonwealth of England was declared.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles I

questions.question: He established the French civil code, which forbade privileges based on birth and allowed freedom of religion. He was quoted as saying My true glory is not to have won 40 battles...Waterloo will erase the memory of so many victories. ... But...what will live forever, is my Civil Code.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte

questions.question: He was King of the Franks from 768 and Emperor of the Romans from 800 to his death in 814. During his reign he expanded the Frankish kingdom into an empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlemagne

questions.question: He was King of the Franks and co-Emperor with his father, Charlemagne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis the Pious

questions.question: This King was largely influenced by his chief mistress, Madame de Pompadour. His decisions weakened the French treasury and discredited the absolute monarchy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XV

questions.question: Famous for her beauty and sense of style, as well as for her scandalous behavior, she married King Henry III of Navarre who finally became King Henri IV of France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret of France

questions.question: He is the only King of France ever to be executed. His wife Marie Antoinette shared the same fate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XVI

questions.question: He was the first monarch of the House of Tudor and last king of England to win his throne on the field of battle. He defeated his opponent Richard III in the Battle of Bosworth Field, the penultimate battle of the War of the Roses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry VII

questions.question: Besides his six marriages, this king is known for his role in the separation of the Church of England from the Roman Catholic Church.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry VIII

questions.question: Her three sons, Francis II, Charles IX and Henry III reigned as Kings of France during the 16th century, in an age of almost constant civil and religious war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catherine de Medici

questions.question: This Bourbon King and his Prime Minister Cardinal Richelieu are described in Alexandre Dumas novel The Three Musketeers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XIII

questions.question: The volcano known as Eyjafjallajokull is closest to what Icelandic City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reykjavic

questions.question: Known as the Sun King, his 72-year-reign is the longest in European history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XIV

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, ground, windsor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With a reign of 326 days, he was one of the shortest-reigning monarchs in British and Commonwealth history. He caused a constitutional crisis by proposing marriage to the American socialite Wallis Simpson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward VIII

questions.question: This singer had a #1 U.S hit in 1988 with the song Right Here Waiting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Marx

questions.question: This King of England is featured in three Shakespearean plays. His military successes in the Hundred Years War culminated with his famous victory at the Battle of Agincourt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry V

questions.question: This group was telling us, dont Rock the Boat, dont tip the boat over in the year 1974. This was the only ever #1 hit for this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hues Corporation

questions.question: What Mexican dish is made with ground seasoned meat, packed in cornmeal dough, wrapped in corn husks and then steamed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tamale

questions.question: This king succeeded his brother Edward assuming the regnal name George VI to emphasise continuity with his father. What was George VIs birth name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert

questions.question: The song Rhinestone Cowboy is considered by many as being just a terrible song from the 1970s but somehow it was a U.S. #1 for this singer in 1975.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glen Campbell

questions.question: The prime meridian passes through Australia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This singer was telling everybody to Rock Me Gently in the year 1974. This song was his only ever #1 hit in the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andy Kim

questions.question: He became the first monarch of the House of Windsor, which he renamed from the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha due to anti-Germanic public feeling. he was the first British monarch to deliver a speech on the radio.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George V

questions.question: Hour for Hour, which of these activities burns the most calories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: rowing

questions.question: Before changing his name to Muhammad Ali, the legendary boxer was known as Cassius Clay.  What was Cassius middle name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marcellus

questions.question: He was King of England and disputed King of France. His bouts of insanity eventually required his wife, Margaret of Anjou, to assume control of his kingdom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry VI

questions.question: The song Ringo was the only ever #1 song by this singer in the year 1964.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lorne Greene

questions.question: He was the first British monarch of the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. During the long reign of his mother, Queen Victoria, he came to personify the fashionable, leisured elite.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward VII

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: England and King
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, raiders, roe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What do Harold II, Richard I and Richard III have in common?

options.text: They failed to produce heirs to the throne.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all died in warfare.

questions.question: Phileas Fogg is the main fictional character in what famous novel?

options.text: Around the World in Eighty Days

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Around the World in Eighty Days

questions.question: This King of England, who ruled from 1100 to 1135, was called Beauclerc for his scholarly interests. His stern rule was followed by a period of civil war, known as the Anarchy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry I

questions.question: Before its name was changed, what was John F. Kennedy International Airport known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Idlewild Airport

questions.question: A childs body temperature is usually slightly higher than an adults.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What currency is used in Guatemala?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quetzal

questions.question: What was the nickname of Edward, the last king of the House of Essex, who ruled from 1042 to 1066?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Confessor

questions.question: Black caviar is made of sturgeon roe.  The eggs of what sturgeon are most highly valued?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: beluga

questions.question: He was the last Anglo-Saxon King of England. He reigned until his death at the Battle of Hastings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harold II

questions.question: In what position is the hammer on the Soviet flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tilted to the left

questions.question: What King of England was known as Longshaks and the Hammer of the Scots?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward I

questions.question: This King of England, who is generally accused of having Edward V and his brother killed, is the subject of an eponymous play by William Shakespeare.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: Even before his accession to the throne, this King of England was known as Cœur de Lion or The Lionheart because of his reputation as a great military leader and warrior.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard I

questions.question: He had been King of Scotland for 36 years when he became King of England and Ireland, succeeding Elizabeth I.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James I

questions.question: Descended from Viking raiders, he was the first Norman King of England, reigning from 1066 until his death in 1087.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William I

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Product and Character
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, title, mascot. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what city does Tiana, the first African American Disney Princess, live at the beginning of the movie The Princess and the Frog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Orleans

questions.question: Which Disney character, voiced by Jodi Benson, falls in love with a man named Eric?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ariel

questions.question: What was the first US made car for which a rebate was offered?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ford Model T

questions.question: This Disney icon is clad in a short lime-green dress and green slippers with white puffs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tinker Bell

questions.question: This free-spirited character with exotic good looks was based on a historical figure. Her name means Little Mischief.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pocahontas

questions.question: Which Disney Princess sings the song A Dream Is a Wish Your Heart Makes to encourage her animal friends to never stop dreaming?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinderella

questions.question: What Disney heroine is looked after by her overprotective mother Gothel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rapunzel

questions.question: Тhis product mascot has been around since 1958 and its name is Cornelius. Name the product.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kelloggs Corn Flakes

questions.question: Which Disney Princess is not married at the end of the original movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jasmine

questions.question: This character is a bad-tempered monarch whose most famous line is Off with their heads!.

options.text: The Wicked Witch of the West

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Queen of Hearts

questions.question: Princess Aurora, the title character of Disneys animated film Sleeping Beauty, was modelled after this actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audrey Hepburn

questions.question: In what Disney movie do Anastasia and Drizella appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinderella

questions.question: Its often said that on men, this is bigger. But theirs make up 2 percent of their total body weight, while womens make up 2-and-half percent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: brain

questions.question: Which of the following was not a king of England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert the Bruce

questions.question: When this product first appeared in the 1938 Sears Roebuck catalog, it was called a gob shirt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tee Shirt
